questions.question: We need …………………… time to repair the roof.
questions.description: We do not use of before a noun when there is no determiner (articles or possessives)

questions.question: It would be nice to explore ……………………….. the countryside.
questions.description: Before a noun with a determiner, we use more of.

questions.question: Hundred years ago much ……………………….. America was covered with trees.
questions.description: Before personal and geographical names we use more of.

questions.question: One ………………………….. the missing sailors has been found.
questions.description: Before a noun with a determiner, we use more of.

questions.question: You are …………………………….. a fool than I thought.
questions.description: Before a noun with a determiner, we use more of.

questions.question: As you get older you get ………………………
questions.description: In this structure we use a comparative in both clauses.

questions.question: ………………………….. cheese is made from cow milk.
questions.description: Before a noun without a determiner, we use most.

questions.question: ……………………………. Indians are Hindus.
questions.description: Before a noun with a determiner, we use more of.

questions.question: The British ruled …………………………. India for about 200 years.
questions.description: We use most of before geographical names.

questions.question: …………………………….. my friends are non-smokers.
questions.description: Before a noun with a determiner, we use most of.

questions.question: …………………………….. us want a new system.
questions.description: Before pronouns we use most of.

questions.question: ………………………….. children love chocolates.
questions.description: When most means ‘the majority of’, it is used without the.
